title: [K-12] VR-Based Multimodal Mathematics Concept Exploration: Integrated Approach for Multilingual Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and ability to use digital devices
context.additional_context: A course where multilingual learners investigate mathematical abstract concepts through visual, auditory, and tactile interactions in VR environments. Concept application abilities are assessed through project-based evaluations

learning_goals: Learners can explain core calculus concepts (limits, continuity, rates of change) by manipulating 3D graphs in a VR environment.
Learners can document the math problem-solving process collaboratively with team members using multimodal representations (visual modeling, audio explanations, text annotations).
Learners can analyze data collected from VR simulations, represent real-world phenomena (e.g., fluid dynamics) as mathematical models, and present their findings.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
